page.title: 03TRANSPORT AND CARLISLE
page.content: Transport is important to Carlisle. Until the mid 18th century the city was cut off;to the North was an enemy border,to the West the sea and to the East and South mountains.Carlisle was usually reached by sea,from Liverpool. In 1763 improved roads allowed the first stagecoach to cross the mount- ains.In 1823 a canal from the coast to the city was opened<p.4>so that the sea-route remained the quickest.It was intended to extend the canal to Newcastle but the newly developing railways replaced other forms of transport by mid 19th century<p.5>. The link with the rest of England is still very important.Carlisle has a small airport,recently reopened,but since 1970 it has been the M6 motorway which has brought business and tourism into the region.
